['Epidermis: The outermost layer of skin, providing a waterproof barrier and creating our skin tone.', 'Dermis: This thick layer lies beneath the epidermis and contains tough connective tissue, hair follicles, and sweat glands.', 'Hypodermis (Subcutaneous Layer): The deepest layer of skin that is made up of fat and connective tissue, which provides insulation and cushioning to the body.', 'Melanocytes: Specialized cells in the epidermis responsible for producing melanin, a pigment that gives color to our skin.', 'Keratinocytes: Cells found predominantly within the epidermis; they produce keratin (proteins), which contributes to the formation of the protective barrier of the skin.', 'Sebaceous glands: Glands in the dermis that secrete an oily substance called sebum, which helps keep the skin moisturized and protected.', 'Blood vessels: Networks of blood vessels within both layers (epidermis and dermis) provide nutrients and remove waste products from skin cells.', 'Hair follicles: Located in the dermis; they are responsible for hair growth, providing warmth and protection.', 'Nails: Hard plates composed of keratin found on the tips of fingers and toes, protecting them.']
